trans-unit.source: Create a PHP-SQL web app and deploy to Azure App Service using Git
trans-unit.target: Create a PHP-SQL web app and deploy to Azure App Service using Git

trans-unit.source: A tutorial that demonstrates how to create a PHP web app that stores data in Azure SQL Database and use Git deployment to Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: A tutorial that demonstrates how to create a PHP web app that stores data in Azure SQL Database and use Git deployment to Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: Create a PHP-SQL web app and deploy to Azure App Service using Git
trans-unit.target: Create a PHP-SQL web app and deploy to Azure App Service using Git

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to create a PHP web app in [Azure App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) that connects to Azure SQL Database and how to deploy it using Git.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to create a PHP web app in [Azure App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) that connects to Azure SQL Database and how to deploy it using Git.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes you have [PHP][install-php], [SQL Server Express][install-SQLExpress], the [Microsoft Drivers for SQL Server for PHP](http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20098), a web server, and [Git][install-git] installed on your computer.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes you have [PHP][install-php], [SQL Server Express][install-SQLExpress], the [Microsoft Drivers for SQL Server for PHP](http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20098), a web server, and [Git][install-git] installed on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Upon completing this guide, you will have a PHP-SQL web app running in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Upon completing this guide, you will have a PHP-SQL web app running in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can install and configure PHP, SQL Server Express, the Microsoft Drivers for SQL Server for PHP, and Internet Information Services (IIS) using the [Microsoft Web Platform Installer](http://www.microsoft.com/web/downloads/platform.aspx).
trans-unit.target: You can install and configure PHP, SQL Server Express, the Microsoft Drivers for SQL Server for PHP, and Internet Information Services (IIS) using the [Microsoft Web Platform Installer](http://www.microsoft.com/web/downloads/platform.aspx).

trans-unit.source: You will learn:
trans-unit.target: You will learn:

trans-unit.source: How to create an Azure web app and a SQL Database using the [Azure preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715).
trans-unit.target: How to create an Azure web app and a SQL Database using the [Azure preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715).

trans-unit.source: Because PHP is enabled in App Service Web Apps by default, nothing special is required to run your PHP code.
trans-unit.target: Because PHP is enabled in App Service Web Apps by default, nothing special is required to run your PHP code.

trans-unit.source: How to publish and re-publish your application to Azure using Git.
trans-unit.target: How to publish and re-publish your application to Azure using Git.

trans-unit.source: By following this tutorial, you will build a simple registration web application in PHP.
trans-unit.target: By following this tutorial, you will build a simple registration web application in PHP.

trans-unit.source: The application will be hosted in an Azure Website.
trans-unit.target: The application will be hosted in an Azure Website.

trans-unit.source: A screenshot of the completed application is below:
trans-unit.target: A screenshot of the completed application is below:

trans-unit.source: Azure PHP Web Site
trans-unit.target: Azure PHP Web Site

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure web app and set up Git publishing
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure web app and set up Git publishing

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create an Azure web app and a SQL Database:
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to create an Azure web app and a SQL Database:

trans-unit.source: Log in to the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com/).
trans-unit.target: Log in to the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com/).

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure Marketplace either by clicking the **Marketplace** icon, or by clicking the **New** icon on the bottom left of the dashboard, selecting **Web + mobile** and then **Azure Marketplace** at the bottom.
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure Marketplace either by clicking the **Marketplace** icon, or by clicking the **New** icon on the bottom left of the dashboard, selecting **Web + mobile** and then **Azure Marketplace** at the bottom.

trans-unit.source: In the Marketplace, select **Web Apps**.
trans-unit.target: In the Marketplace, select **Web Apps**.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Web app + SQL** icon.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Web app + SQL** icon.

trans-unit.source: After reading the description of the Web app + SQL app, select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: After reading the description of the Web app + SQL app, select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Click on each part (**Resource Group**, **Web App**, **Database**, and **Subscription**) and enter or select values for the required fields:
trans-unit.target: Click on each part (**Resource Group**, **Web App**, **Database**, and **Subscription**) and enter or select values for the required fields:

trans-unit.source: Enter a URL name of your choice
trans-unit.target: Enter a URL name of your choice

trans-unit.source: Configure database server credentials
trans-unit.target: Configure database server credentials

trans-unit.source: Select the region closest to you
trans-unit.target: Select the region closest to you

trans-unit.source: configure your app
trans-unit.target: configure your app

trans-unit.source: When finished defining the web app, click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: When finished defining the web app, click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: When the web app has been created, the **Notifications** button will flash a green **SUCCESS** and the resource group blade open to show both the web app and the SQL database in the group.
trans-unit.target: When the web app has been created, the **Notifications** button will flash a green **SUCCESS** and the resource group blade open to show both the web app and the SQL database in the group.

trans-unit.source: Click the web app's icon in the resource group blade to open the web app's blade.
trans-unit.target: Click the web app's icon in the resource group blade to open the web app's blade.

trans-unit.source: web app's resource group
trans-unit.target: web app's resource group

trans-unit.source: Click **Set up continuous deployment** > **Choose Source**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Set up continuous deployment** > **Choose Source**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Local Git Repository** and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Local Git Repository** and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: where is your source code
trans-unit.target: where is your source code

trans-unit.source: If you have not set up a Git repository before, you must provide a user name and password.
trans-unit.target: If you have not set up a Git repository before, you must provide a user name and password.

trans-unit.source: To do this, click **Set deployment credentials** in the web app's blade.
trans-unit.target: To do this, click **Set deployment credentials** in the web app's blade.

trans-unit.source: **Set up continous deployment** becomes **No deployment found**.
trans-unit.target: **Set up continous deployment** becomes **No deployment found**.

trans-unit.source: Click it to see the Git remote URL you need to use to deploy your PHP app later.
trans-unit.target: Click it to see the Git remote URL you need to use to deploy your PHP app later.

trans-unit.source: Get SQL Database connection information
trans-unit.target: Get SQL Database connection information

trans-unit.source: To connect to the SQL Database instance that is linked to your web app, your will need the connection information, which you specified when you created the database.
trans-unit.target: To connect to the SQL Database instance that is linked to your web app, your will need the connection information, which you specified when you created the database.

trans-unit.source: To get the SQL Database connection information, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To get the SQL Database connection information, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: Back in the resource group's blade, click the SQL database's icon.
trans-unit.target: Back in the resource group's blade, click the SQL database's icon.

trans-unit.source: In the SQL database's blade, click **Properties**, then click **Show database connection strings**.
trans-unit.target: In the SQL database's blade, click **Properties**, then click **Show database connection strings**.

trans-unit.source: View database properties
trans-unit.target: View database properties

trans-unit.source: From the **PHP** section of the resulting dialog, make note of the values for `Server`, `SQL Database`, and `User Name`.
trans-unit.target: From the **PHP** section of the resulting dialog, make note of the values for `Server`, `SQL Database`, and `User Name`.

trans-unit.source: You will use these values later when publishing your PHP web app to Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: You will use these values later when publishing your PHP web app to Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: Build and test your application locally
trans-unit.target: Build and test your application locally

trans-unit.source: The Registration application is a simple PHP application that allows you to register for an event by providing your name and email address.
trans-unit.target: The Registration application is a simple PHP application that allows you to register for an event by providing your name and email address.

trans-unit.source: Information about previous registrants is displayed in a table.
trans-unit.target: Information about previous registrants is displayed in a table.

trans-unit.source: Registration information is stored in a SQL Database instance.
trans-unit.target: Registration information is stored in a SQL Database instance.

trans-unit.source: The application consists of two files (copy/paste code available below):
trans-unit.target: The application consists of two files (copy/paste code available below):

trans-unit.source: **index.php**: Displays a form for registration and a table containing registrant information.
trans-unit.target: **index.php**: Displays a form for registration and a table containing registrant information.

trans-unit.source: **createtable.php**: Creates the SQL Database table for the application.
trans-unit.target: **createtable.php**: Creates the SQL Database table for the application.

trans-unit.source: This file will only be used once.
trans-unit.target: This file will only be used once.

trans-unit.source: To run the application locally, follow the steps below.
trans-unit.target: To run the application locally, follow the steps below.

trans-unit.source: Note that these steps assume you have PHP, SQL Server Express, and a web server set up on your local machine, and that you have enabled the [PDO extension for SQL Server][pdo-sqlsrv].
trans-unit.target: Note that these steps assume you have PHP, SQL Server Express, and a web server set up on your local machine, and that you have enabled the [PDO extension for SQL Server][pdo-sqlsrv].

trans-unit.source: Create a SQL Server database called `registration`.
trans-unit.target: Create a SQL Server database called `registration`.

trans-unit.source: You can do this from the `sqlcmd` command prompt with these commands:
trans-unit.target: You can do this from the `sqlcmd` command prompt with these commands:

trans-unit.source: In your web server's root directory, create a folder called `registration` and create two files in it - one called `createtable.php` and one called `index.php`.
trans-unit.target: In your web server's root directory, create a folder called `registration` and create two files in it - one called `createtable.php` and one called `index.php`.

trans-unit.source: Open the `createtable.php` file in a text editor or IDE and add the code below.
trans-unit.target: Open the `createtable.php` file in a text editor or IDE and add the code below.

trans-unit.source: This code will be used to create the `registration_tbl` table in the `registration` database.
trans-unit.target: This code will be used to create the `registration_tbl` table in the `registration` database.

trans-unit.source: Note that you will need to update the values for $user and $pwd with your local SQL Server user name and password.
trans-unit.target: Note that you will need to update the values for $user and $pwd with your local SQL Server user name and password.

trans-unit.source: Open a web browser and browse to **http://localhost/registration/createtable.php**.
trans-unit.target: Open a web browser and browse to **http://localhost/registration/createtable.php**.

trans-unit.source: This will create the `registration_tbl` table in the database.
trans-unit.target: This will create the `registration_tbl` table in the database.

trans-unit.source: Open the **index.php** file in a text editor or IDE and add the basic HTML and CSS code for the page (the PHP code will be added in later steps).
trans-unit.target: Open the **index.php** file in a text editor or IDE and add the basic HTML and CSS code for the page (the PHP code will be added in later steps).

trans-unit.source: Within the PHP tags, add PHP code for connecting to the database.
trans-unit.target: Within the PHP tags, add PHP code for connecting to the database.

trans-unit.source: Again, you will need to update the values for $user and $pwd with your local MySQL user name and password.
trans-unit.target: Again, you will need to update the values for $user and $pwd with your local MySQL user name and password.

trans-unit.source: Following the database connection code, add code for inserting registration information into the database.
trans-unit.target: Following the database connection code, add code for inserting registration information into the database.

trans-unit.source: Finally, following the code above, add code for retrieving data from the database.
trans-unit.target: Finally, following the code above, add code for retrieving data from the database.

trans-unit.source: You can now browse to **http://localhost/registration/index.php** to test the application.
trans-unit.target: You can now browse to **http://localhost/registration/index.php** to test the application.

trans-unit.source: Publish your application
trans-unit.target: Publish your application

trans-unit.source: After you have tested your application locally, you can publish it to App Service Web Apps using Git.
trans-unit.target: After you have tested your application locally, you can publish it to App Service Web Apps using Git.

trans-unit.source: However, you first need to update the database connection information in the application.
trans-unit.target: However, you first need to update the database connection information in the application.

trans-unit.source: Using the database connection information you obtained earlier (in the **Get SQL Database connection information** section), update the following information in **both** the `createdatabase.php` and `index.php` files with the appropriate values:
trans-unit.target: Using the database connection information you obtained earlier (in the **Get SQL Database connection information** section), update the following information in **both** the `createdatabase.php` and `index.php` files with the appropriate values:

trans-unit.source: In the $host, the value of Server must be prepended with tcp:.
trans-unit.target: In the $host, the value of Server must be prepended with tcp:.

trans-unit.source: Now, you are ready to set up Git publishing and publish the application.
trans-unit.target: Now, you are ready to set up Git publishing and publish the application.

trans-unit.source: These are the same steps noted at the end of the **Create an Azure web app and set up Git publishing** section above.
trans-unit.target: These are the same steps noted at the end of the **Create an Azure web app and set up Git publishing** section above.

trans-unit.source: Open GitBash (or a terminal, if Git is in your `PATH`), change directories to the root directory of your application (the **registration** directory), and run the following commands:
trans-unit.target: Open GitBash (or a terminal, if Git is in your `PATH`), change directories to the root directory of your application (the **registration** directory), and run the following commands:

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted for the password you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted for the password you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Browse to **http://[web app name].azurewebsites.net/createtable.php** to create the SQL database table for the application.
trans-unit.target: Browse to **http://[web app name].azurewebsites.net/createtable.php** to create the SQL database table for the application.

trans-unit.source: Browse to **http://[web app name].azurewebsites.net/index.php** to begin using the application.
trans-unit.target: Browse to **http://[web app name].azurewebsites.net/index.php** to begin using the application.

trans-unit.source: After you have published your application, you can begin making changes to it and use Git to publish them.
trans-unit.target: After you have published your application, you can begin making changes to it and use Git to publish them.

trans-unit.source: Publish changes to your application
trans-unit.target: Publish changes to your application

trans-unit.source: To publish changes to application, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To publish changes to application, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: Make changes to your application locally.
trans-unit.target: Make changes to your application locally.

trans-unit.source: Open GitBash (or a terminal, it Git is in your `PATH`), change directories to the root directory of your application, and run the following commands:
trans-unit.target: Open GitBash (or a terminal, it Git is in your `PATH`), change directories to the root directory of your application, and run the following commands:

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted for the password you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted for the password you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Browse to **http://[web app name].azurewebsites.net/index.php** to see your changes.
trans-unit.target: Browse to **http://[web app name].azurewebsites.net/index.php** to see your changes.

trans-unit.source: What's changed
trans-unit.target: What's changed

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)

trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the portal to the preview portal see: [Reference for navigating the preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)
